tasks.title: Implement WebSocket Communication Protocol
tasks.description: Establish the WebSocket communication protocol between the macOS client and Raspberry Pi server for reliable messaging.
tasks.details: Create a Python-based WebSocket protocol implementation with structured JSON messaging for audio streaming and transcription results. Define message types for connection establishment, audio data transmission, transcription results, status updates, and error handling. Implement automatic reconnection logic and ensure low-latency communication (<100ms on local network). Use the 'websockets' library for Python implementation. Message structure should include message type, timestamp, payload, and sequence identifiers for reliable ordering.
tasks.testStrategy: Create unit tests for message serialization/deserialization. Implement connection tests with simulated network interruptions to verify reconnection capabilities. Measure round-trip latency under various network conditions to ensure it meets the <100ms requirement on local networks.

subtasks.title: Define WebSocket Message Structure and Types
subtasks.description: Design and document the JSON message structure for all communication, including required fields (message type, timestamp, payload, sequence ID) and message types (connection, audio, transcription, status, error, ping/pong, client management, performance tracking).
subtasks.details: Create a schema for all message types to ensure reliable ordering and structured communication. Reference protocol requirements in prd_draft.md.
subtasks.testStrategy: Validate schema with sample messages and automated schema checks.

subtasks.title: Implement WebSocket Server on Raspberry Pi
subtasks.description: Develop the Python-based WebSocket server using the 'websockets' library, supporting structured JSON messaging and handling all defined message types.
subtasks.details: Follow pi_speech_server_setup.md Step 4 for server setup. Implement handlers for connection, audio, transcription, status, error, ping/pong, client management, and performance tracking.
subtasks.testStrategy: Test server with mock clients and automated message type validation.

subtasks.title: Implement WebSocket Client on macOS
subtasks.description: Develop the Python-based WebSocket client for macOS, capable of sending and receiving structured JSON messages and handling all defined message types.
subtasks.details: Ensure client supports connection establishment, audio data transmission, transcription results, status updates, error handling, ping/pong, and performance tracking.
subtasks.testStrategy: Test client against the server with automated message exchange and validation.

subtasks.title: Implement Automatic Reconnection and Error Handling
subtasks.description: Add logic for automatic reconnection and robust error handling for both client and server, ensuring reliable communication under network interruptions.
subtasks.details: Implement reconnection attempts, error logging, and graceful handling of disconnections. Ensure low-latency (<100ms) communication on local network.
subtasks.testStrategy: Simulate network interruptions and verify reconnection and error handling.

subtasks.title: Validate and Optimize Communication Performance
subtasks.description: Measure and optimize end-to-end latency, message ordering, and throughput for audio streaming and transcription results.
subtasks.details: Profile communication, ensure latency <100ms, validate reliable message ordering, and optimize for high throughput. Include performance tracking in message structure.
subtasks.testStrategy: Conduct latency and throughput tests, analyze logs, and optimize as needed.

tasks.title: Develop Docker-based Mock Server Environment
tasks.description: Create a Docker-based development environment that simulates the Raspberry Pi server for testing without Pi hardware.
tasks.details: Implement a Docker container that runs a Python WebSocket server with a mock implementation of the faster-whisper transcription service. The mock server should accept audio streams via WebSocket, simulate processing time based on model selection (tiny.en vs small.en), and return realistic transcription results. Include configuration options for simulating different latency profiles and error conditions. Use Docker Compose for easy setup and teardown. The mock server should implement the same WebSocket protocol as the actual Pi server.
tasks.testStrategy: Verify Docker container builds and runs correctly. Test WebSocket connections from client applications. Validate that mock transcription results are returned with appropriate simulated delays. Ensure the mock server can handle concurrent connections and properly simulates the resource constraints of a Raspberry Pi 5.

tasks.title: Implement Basic Audio Recording System
tasks.description: Create a PyAudio-based voice capture system for the macOS client that records high-quality audio suitable for transcription.
tasks.details: Implement audio recording functionality using PyAudio to capture 16kHz mono audio in 20ms chunks with 16-bit integer format. Ensure proper microphone selection and permission handling on macOS. Include audio level monitoring and visualization feedback. Implement a buffer system to store audio chunks for streaming. The recording system should handle device disconnection gracefully and provide clear error messages for permission issues. Use pyobjc to request microphone permissions on macOS.
tasks.testStrategy: Test recording with various microphones and audio settings. Verify audio quality meets requirements for transcription. Validate proper handling of permission requests and denials. Ensure recording starts and stops correctly without audio artifacts.

tasks.title: Develop Global Hotkey System
tasks.description: Implement a global hotkey detection system using pynput to control recording with Fn key for push-to-talk and Fn+SPACE for continuous lock mode.
tasks.details: Use pynput library to implement global hotkey listeners for the Fn key (push-to-talk) and Fn+SPACE combination (continuous recording toggle). Handle key press and release events to start and stop recording appropriately. Implement a state machine to track recording modes (idle, push-to-talk, continuous). Provide visual feedback for the current recording state. Ensure hotkeys work across all applications regardless of focus. Handle edge cases like key release events not being captured if the application loses focus.
tasks.testStrategy: Test hotkey detection across various macOS applications. Verify push-to-talk functionality works correctly when Fn is pressed and released. Confirm continuous recording mode toggles properly with Fn+SPACE. Ensure hotkeys don't interfere with normal keyboard operation in other applications.

tasks.title: Implement Audio Streaming to Server
tasks.description: Create a system to stream recorded audio chunks in real-time to the WebSocket server for processing.
tasks.details: Implement a streaming system that sends 20ms audio chunks to the WebSocket server as they are recorded. Use the established WebSocket protocol to package audio data in the correct format (16kHz mono, 16-bit integer). Include sequence numbers and timestamps for proper ordering. Implement a buffer management system to handle network latency without audio loss. Add compression if needed to reduce bandwidth usage. Ensure the streaming system can reconnect automatically if the connection is lost.
tasks.testStrategy: Test streaming with various network conditions including packet loss and latency. Verify all audio chunks are received in the correct order by the server. Measure bandwidth usage to ensure it's within acceptable limits for local networks. Test reconnection capabilities during active streaming.

tasks.title: Implement Text Insertion via Accessibility API
tasks.description: Develop a system to insert transcribed text at the cursor position in any macOS application using the Accessibility API.
tasks.details: Use pyobjc to access the macOS Accessibility API for inserting text at the current cursor position. Implement permission handling for accessibility features. Detect the current active application and text field. Insert transcribed text at the cursor position without disrupting the user's workflow. Handle different text field types and edge cases. Implement a queue system for text insertion to handle rapid transcription results. Ensure proper handling of special characters and formatting.
tasks.testStrategy: Test text insertion across various macOS applications including text editors, browsers, and productivity tools. Verify text appears at the correct cursor position. Test with different text lengths and special characters. Ensure permissions are properly requested and handled.

tasks.title: Configure Raspberry Pi Server with faster-whisper
tasks.description: Set up the Raspberry Pi 5 server with faster-whisper integration for local speech-to-text processing.
tasks.details: Install and configure faster-whisper on Raspberry Pi 5 with optimizations for the ARM architecture. Set up model loading for both tiny.en (39MB) and small.en (244MB) models. Implement model caching to reduce startup time. Configure the WebSocket server to accept audio streams and return transcription results. Implement temperature monitoring and thermal management to prevent overheating during sustained processing. Create a systemd service for automatic startup and recovery. Optimize memory usage to work within the 8GB RAM constraint of the Pi 5.
tasks.testStrategy: Benchmark transcription speed and accuracy with both tiny.en and small.en models. Monitor temperature during sustained operation to ensure thermal stability. Test memory usage under load to prevent out-of-memory errors. Verify model loading and initialization times meet performance requirements.

tasks.title: Implement Voice Activity Detection
tasks.description: Add Voice Activity Detection (VAD) to optimize processing by reducing unnecessary transcription of silence.
tasks.details: Implement a Voice Activity Detection system using WebRTC VAD or a similar lightweight solution. Configure the VAD to detect speech vs. silence in the audio stream. Only send audio chunks containing speech to the server for processing, reducing processing overhead by 60-80%. Implement proper segmentation of speech with padding before and after detected speech to avoid clipping. Add configuration options for VAD sensitivity. Ensure the VAD works efficiently on the client side to reduce network traffic.
tasks.testStrategy: Test VAD with various speech patterns and background noise levels. Measure reduction in processing load and network traffic. Verify no speech is missed or clipped. Test with different languages and speaking styles to ensure robust detection.

tasks.title: Implement Error Handling and Recovery
tasks.description: Develop comprehensive error handling for network interruptions, audio system issues, and transcription failures.
tasks.details: Implement robust error handling throughout the application. Handle WebSocket connection failures with automatic reconnection and session recovery. Manage audio device disconnection or permission changes. Implement graceful degradation for transcription errors. Create a logging system for error tracking and diagnostics. Provide clear user feedback for error conditions with actionable resolution steps. Implement watchdog timers for detecting and recovering from hung states. Create a system for reporting critical errors to the user.
tasks.testStrategy: Simulate various error conditions including network failures, device disconnections, and permission changes. Verify the application recovers gracefully from each error type. Test logging system captures relevant diagnostic information. Ensure error messages are clear and helpful to users.

tasks.title: Implement AppleScript Fallback for Text Insertion
tasks.description: Create a secondary text insertion method using AppleScript as a fallback when the Accessibility API is unavailable.
tasks.details: Implement an AppleScript-based text insertion system as a fallback mechanism. Use pyobjc to execute AppleScript commands for inserting text at the cursor position. Detect when the Accessibility API fails and automatically switch to AppleScript. Handle application-specific edge cases and compatibility issues. Create a preference system to allow users to choose their preferred insertion method. Test compatibility with popular macOS applications.
tasks.testStrategy: Test AppleScript text insertion across various macOS applications. Verify automatic fallback when Accessibility API fails. Compare performance and reliability between the two methods. Test with applications known to have compatibility issues with either method.

tasks.title: Implement Continuous Recording Mode
tasks.description: Develop the continuous recording mode toggled by Fn+SPACE with Voice Activity Detection for efficient processing.
tasks.details: Extend the recording system to support a continuous recording mode toggled by Fn+SPACE. Implement a visual indicator for when continuous mode is active. Integrate with Voice Activity Detection to segment speech and reduce processing load. Implement automatic timeout after extended periods of silence to conserve resources. Create a buffer management system to handle continuous audio streams efficiently. Ensure the user can easily toggle between push-to-talk and continuous modes.
tasks.testStrategy: Test continuous recording mode with various speech patterns and silence durations. Verify proper toggling with Fn+SPACE. Measure resource usage during extended continuous recording sessions. Test integration with VAD for efficient processing.

tasks.title: Implement Performance Monitoring and Optimization
tasks.description: Create systems for monitoring and optimizing performance including latency measurement and thermal management.
tasks.details: Implement comprehensive performance monitoring throughout the system. Measure and log end-to-end latency from audio capture to text insertion. Monitor Raspberry Pi temperature and throttle processing if necessary to prevent overheating. Track WebSocket connection quality and adapt to changing network conditions. Implement adaptive quality settings based on system performance. Create a dashboard for visualizing performance metrics. Optimize critical paths to meet the 2-second latency target.
tasks.testStrategy: Benchmark end-to-end latency under various conditions. Monitor system performance during extended usage. Verify thermal management prevents overheating. Test adaptive quality settings under different load conditions.

tasks.title: Conduct End-to-End Testing
tasks.description: Perform comprehensive end-to-end testing of the complete workflow with performance metrics.
tasks.details: Design and execute end-to-end tests covering the entire workflow from audio recording to text insertion. Measure performance metrics including latency, accuracy, and reliability. Test with various speech patterns, accents, and background noise levels. Verify compatibility with different macOS applications and text fields. Test both push-to-talk and continuous recording modes. Create automated test scripts where possible. Document test results and identify areas for improvement.
tasks.testStrategy: Create a test matrix covering all major features and use cases. Measure key performance indicators against success metrics defined in the PRD. Test with multiple users to account for different speech patterns and usage styles. Document and prioritize any issues discovered.

tasks.title: Create User Documentation
tasks.description: Develop comprehensive documentation including setup guides and troubleshooting resources.
tasks.details: Create detailed documentation for both end users and developers. Include step-by-step setup instructions for the Raspberry Pi server and macOS client. Document all features and usage patterns. Create troubleshooting guides for common issues. Include network setup recommendations for optimal performance. Document the WebSocket protocol for future extensions. Create API documentation for developers. Include performance optimization tips and best practices.
tasks.testStrategy: Have users follow documentation to set up the system from scratch. Identify and address any unclear or missing information. Verify troubleshooting guides effectively resolve common issues. Ensure documentation is accessible and easy to navigate.

tasks.title: Implement Deployment Automation
tasks.description: Create automated deployment scripts for streamlined Pi configuration and client installation.
tasks.details: Develop automated deployment scripts for both the Raspberry Pi server and macOS client. Create a one-click installer for the macOS client that handles permissions and dependencies. Implement a setup script for the Raspberry Pi that installs all required components and configures the system for optimal performance. Include update mechanisms for both client and server. Create backup and restore functionality for user settings and configurations. Implement version checking to ensure compatibility between client and server.
tasks.testStrategy: Test deployment on fresh systems to verify all components are correctly installed and configured. Verify permissions are properly requested and set. Test update mechanisms to ensure smooth transitions between versions. Verify backup and restore functionality preserves all user settings.
